# The furnace was initially out of coal, but I successfully inserted more coal, bringing the total to 50 units.
# I also inserted 10 Iron Ore into the furnace, which is now actively working to smelt the Iron Ore into Iron Plates.

# Now, I will monitor the furnace to ensure that it completes the smelting process and produces the Iron Plates.
# I will check the inventory periodically to see if the Iron Plates are being produced.

# Let's implement a monitoring loop to check the inventory for Iron Plates.
for _ in range(30):  # Maximum wait time of 30 seconds
    current_inventory = inspect_inventory()  # Check the current inventory
    iron_plate_count = current_inventory.get(Prototype.IronPlate, 0)  # Get the count of Iron Plates
    print(f"Current Iron Plate count: {iron_plate_count}")  # Log the current count of Iron Plates
    
    if iron_plate_count >= 10:  # Check if we have at least 10 Iron Plates
        print("Sufficient Iron Plates are ready.")
        break  # Exit the loop if we have enough Iron Plates
    
    sleep(1)  # Wait for 1 second before checking again
else:
    print("Smelting timeout - check fuel and inputs")  # Timeout check failed

# After the loop, I will log the final inventory status and entities on the map.
final_inventory_status = inspect_inventory()  # Final inventory check
print(f"Final Inventory Status: {final_inventory_status}")  # Log final resource overview
print(f"Entities on the map: {get_entities()}")  # Log current state of entities in the game.
